newsitem.title: USA: NFL-SAINTS NAME RICK VENTURI INTERIM HEAD COACH.
newsitem.headline: NFL-SAINTS NAME RICK VENTURI INTERIM HEAD COACH.

text.p: The New Orleans Saints on Wednesday named linebackers coach Rick Venturi as interim head coach to replace Jim Mora, who resigned on Monday after guiding the NFL club for 10 1/2 years.

Venturi was appointed after Tuesday's confusion in which Director of Pro Personnel Chet Franklin turned down the job, forcing the team to postpone a news conference in which he was to be named to succeed Mora.
Venturi is in his 15th season in the NFL. He spent 12 years with the Indianapolis Colts organisation, first as a linebackers coach and defensive coordinator.
The Colts promoted Venturi to interim head coach during the the 1991 season, but the team posted a dismal 1-10 record over the final 11 games under Venturi.
Mora, who had the longest continuous term of service with the same team of any current coach, resigned one day after berated his club following a 19-7 loss at Carolina.
During a furious tirade, Mora said he "was embarrassed and ashamed of our team."
The 61-year-old Mora compiled a 93-78 record, guiding the team to its first winning season and playoff berth. But the Saints have not had a winning record since 1992.
Venturi takes over a club with a 2-6 record, but he tried to put on optimistic spin on the Saints' future.

"This team has won two of the last three football games," Venturi said. "It approaches the last eight weeks with optimism, with committment. I feel this is a good opportunity. I feel this football team can be successful."
